questions.text: A 2-year-old child came in complaining of a sore throat, noisy breathing, and difficulty breathing. On examination stridor is present. What is correct about stridor?

options.label: A
options.text: It is an auditory manifestation of disordered respiratory function due to airflow changes within the larynx or bronchi

options.label: B
options.text: It needs investigation in every case

options.label: C
options.text: It is due to turbulence of air within a partially obstructed respiratory tract

questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above Stridor is a high-pitched musical breath sound resulting from the turbulent airflow in the larynx or bronchi. Stridor is a physical sign which is caused by a narrowed or obstructed airway. It can be inspiratory, expiratory, or biphasic. Inspiratory stridor often occurs in croup. It may be serious airway obstruction from severe conditions like epiglottitis and foreign bodies obstruction. Stridor should always command attention to establish its cause.

questions.text: All are causes of congenital stridor except:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Epiglottitis Acute epiglottitis is an infection caused by Haemophilus influenzae. Rest all others are example of congenital stridor.

questions.text: A 2-month-old child came with the complaint of noisy breathing which increased with crying and feeding. The probable diagnosis is laryngomalacia. What is not a feature?

options.label: A
options.text: Usually present from birth or first few weeks of life

options.label: B
options.text: Tends to get better after 3-4 months

options.label: D
options.text: It is due to the prolapse of tissue into the larynx during inspiration.

questions.correct_answer: C. Always be investigated with microlaryngoscopy
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Always be investigated with microlaryngoscopy Laryngomalacia usually causes inspiratory stridor in babies. If the baby is thriving and feeding well with no respiratory distress then they do not need microlaryngoscopy. But this should be considered if the stridor is getting worse or there are any life-threatening features such as intermittent cyanosis.

questions.text: Laryngomalacia is the most common congenital abnormality resulting in stridor. In most cases, treatment is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Conservative management In laryngomalacia, usually reassurance and posture repositioning is done. Manage dysphagia and reflux symptoms if present. In 15-20% of cases, progressive respiratory distress performed SUPRAGLOTTOPLASTY.

questions.text: A 2-month-old child came to the pediatric department with the complaint of noisy breathing which increases in crying whenever her mother tries to feed her. It increases in the supine position. What could be the probable diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Laryngomalacia The above case presentation is of laryngomalacia. Inspiratory stridor starts after birth increases till 6 months and subsides by 2 years. Stridor increases with exertion (feeding, crying, agitation) and in the supine position. Stridor reduces with a change in posture.

questions.text: A 3-month-old child complained of low-grade fever, cough, and some breathing difficulty. Furthermore, his father said that his mother also had a runny nose and cough, and breathing difficulty a few days ago which resolves on its own. The X-Ray is shown in below image: what could be the organism causing the disease?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Respiratory Syncytial Virus( RSV) The above case scenario is of Bronchiolitis . The signs and symptoms of bronchiolitis are low-grade fever, cough, and breathing difficulty. The most common organism causing bronchiolitis is the Respiratory syncytial virus.

questions.text: Ribavirin is used when bronchiolitis is associated with all except?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Failure to thrive Ribavirin is used when bronchiolitis is associated with congenital heart disease, chronic lung disease, and immunodeficiency.

questions.text: Palivizumab is indicated for prophylaxis in bronchiolitis in all conditions except?

options.label: C
options.text: Children with chronic lung disease of prematurity

questions.correct_answer: A. Children born more than 29 weeks
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Children born more than 29 weeks Palivizumab is indicated for prophylaxis in bronchiolitis in: Children less than 29 weeks. Children with significant heart disease Children with chronic lung disease of prematurity Immunodeficiency

questions.text: Severe cases of bronchiolitis obliterans that cause major irreversible damage to the lungs and significantly impair a patient's ability to breathe properly may require what treatment?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Lung transplant In severe cases of bronchiolitis obliterans lung transplant is the only option. Other treatment options include corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, and azithromycin.

questions.text: Cough associated with bronchiolitis obliterans can be treated with?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Corticosteroid Treatment for bronchiolitis obliterans includes corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, or azithromycin.
